summary: extended and improved version of the mod by Silverknight7. Now with a concentration version of the transmute spell!
descriptionHtml:
Posted with the permission of the original author...so to start with, the original mod is this one: http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27495/?
Not required, in fact you may as well not download it, but endorsing it would be nice, since without it I wouldn't have gotten around to this one.
Changes:
-Get stuck smelting, without using magicka: GONE!
-Magicka is only used when you actually transmute or smelt something! Costs less and works faster the higher your alteration skill!
-moved all the smelt spells to the alteration trainer. currently only changes one leveled list.

-added an option to support some crafting overhauls, such as CCO. It's a global variable (oressmelt, yes I'm that lazy)! There's an optional file (included in download) if you don't want to bother changing it yourself. just load that after the first file.
-have dozens, hundreds, even thousands of ore? Not a problem. The concentrated transmutation spell will transmute in multiples of 10, up to 10k.
-concentrated transmutation is different than most spells, in that dual casting is cheaper, rather than having twice as powerful an effect. This is to preserve balance...no sense having 1 iron ore turn into 4 gold ore.

Not changed:
-dual casting smelt spells will produce two ingots. It's not too imbalanced as a feature, considering how much of the ore is actually gold is up for debate. Especially with CCO...5 ores per bar.
-visual effects. Because pretty and shiny.

Short version:
-Cool, balanced spells transmutation and smelting spells for sale at anyone that sells books from the alteration25 spellbook list.

Possible updates:
-Switch from editing leveled lists to using that one function that adds items to a leveled list, when I figure out where it was and how to use it. (post info on it if you know what and where it is)
-Add in support for the mage stone perk (cheaper spells one.)
-moving ebony smelting to the master level, given how costly and useful it is.

Changelog:
2.01: Forgot (to remove) some conditions earlier, which rendered some spells useless, such as dual-casted mithril/quicksilver transmutes. Removed all conditions from the smelt spell records, as the magic effects and the script handle that.
